1.1 IFC4.3 AbRV - Scope settings

  • changes by Matthias (25.01.2022): remove separate Rail definitions
1 IfcRoot

IfcRoot

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcRoot
IfcRoot
Object Occurrence Attributes
Property Sets
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.
1.1 IfcObjectDefinition

IfcObjectDefinition

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcObjectDefinition
IfcObjectDefinition
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Layer Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialLayerSet.MaterialLayers[*]
\IfcMaterialLayer.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material layer is known.
Material Profile Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialProfileSet.MaterialProfiles[*]
\IfcMaterialProfile.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material profile is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Object Assignment
Object Association
Object Composition
Object Attributes
Object Occurrence Attributes
Property Sets
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.
1.1.1 IfcContext

IfcContext

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcContext
IfcContext
Project Classification Information\IfcContext.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassification.Source
\IfcLabel
Source (or publisher) for this classification. > NOTE  that the source of the classification means the person or organization that was the original author or the person or organization currently acting as the publisher.
Project Context\IfcContext.LongName
\IfcLabel
Long name for the context as used for reference purposes.
Project Declaration\IfcContext.Declares[*]
\IfcRelDeclares.RelatedDefinitions[*]
Set of object or property definitions that are assigned to a context and to which the unit and representation context definitions of that context apply.
Project Global Positioning\IfcContext.RepresentationContexts[*]
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext.HasCoordinateOperation[*]
\IfcMapConversion.Eastings
\IfcLengthMeasure
Specifies the location along the easting of the coordinate system of the target map coordinate reference system. > NOTE  for right-handed Cartesian coordinate systems this would establish the location along the x axis.
Project Library Information\IfcContext.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryInformation.Version
\IfcLabel
Identifier for the library version used for reference.
Project Representation Context\IfcContext.RepresentationContexts[*]
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext.ContextIdentifier
\IfcLabel
The optional identifier of the representation context as used within a project.
Project Representation Context 3D\IfcContext.RepresentationContexts[*]
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext.ContextIdentifier
\IfcLabel
The optional identifier of the representation context as used within a project.
Project Template Definitions\IfcContext.Declares[*]
\IfcRelDeclares.RelatedDefinitions[*]
\IfcPropertySetTemplate.TemplateType
\IfcPropertySetTemplateTypeEnum
Property set type defining whether the property set is applicable to a type (subtypes of _IfcTypeObject_), to an occurrence (subtypes of _IfcObject_), or as a special case to a performance history. The attribute _ApplicableEntity_ may further refine the applicability to a single or multiple entity type(s).
Project Type Definitions\IfcContext.Declares[*]
\IfcRelDeclares.RelatedDefinitions[*]
\IfcTypeObject
Set of object or property definitions that are assigned to a context and to which the unit and representation context definitions of that context apply.
Project Units\IfcContext.UnitsInContext
\IfcUnitAssignment.Units[*]
\IfcDerivedUnit.UnitType
\IfcDerivedUnitEnum
Name of the derived unit chosen from an enumeration of derived unit types for use in IFC models.
1.1.1.1 IfcProject

IfcProject

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcProject
IfcProject
Pset_ProjectCommon\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Project Classification Information
Project Declaration
Project Global Positioning
Project Library Information
Project Representation Context
Project Representation Context 3D
Project Template Definitions
Project Type Definitions
Project Units
Classification Association
Spatial Decomposition
Revision Control
Software Identity

IfcProjectLibrary

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcProjectLibrary
IfcProjectLibrary
Project Classification Information
Project Context
Project Declaration
Project Library Information
Project Representation Context
Project Representation Context 3D

Project Units
1.1.2 IfcObject

IfcObject

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcObject
IfcObject
Object Connectivity
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Property Sets with Override\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
1.1.2.3 IfcGroup

IfcGroup

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcGroup
IfcGroup
Group Assignment\IfcGroup.IsGroupedBy[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcProduct
Related objects, which are assigned to a single object. The type of the single (or relating) object is defined in the subtypes of IfcRelAssigns.
Pset_Risk\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.

The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.

1.1.2.5 IfcProduct

IfcProduct

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcProduct
IfcProduct
Body Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
FootPrint Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.RepresentationIdentifier
\IfcLabel
The optional identifier of the representation as used within a project.
FootPrint GeomSet Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.RepresentationIdentifier
\IfcLabel
The optional identifier of the representation as used within a project.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Reference Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Reference SweptSolid Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Reference SweptSolid PolyCurve Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Reference Tessellation Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Pset_Risk\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_Tolerance\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_Uncertainty\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
1.1.2.5.1 IfcAnnotation

IfcAnnotation

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcAnnotation
IfcAnnotation
Pset_Width\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Annotation 2D Geometry\IfcAnnotation.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Annotation']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Annotation 3D Geometry\IfcAnnotation.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Annotation']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Pset_Superelevation\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_AnnotationContourLine\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_AnnotationLineOfSight\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_AnnotationSurveyArea\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_SoundAttenuation\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.
1.1.2.5.2 IfcElement

IfcElement

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcElement
IfcElement
Body AdvancedSweptSolid Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body SurfaceModel Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body SweptSolid Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body SweptSolid PolyCurve Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body Tessellation Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Clearance Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Clearance']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Element Composition\IfcElement.Decomposes[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatingObject
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Connectivity\IfcElement.ConnectedFrom[*]
Reference to the element connection relationship. The relationship then refers to the other element that is connected to this element.
Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Nesting\IfcElement.IsNestedBy[*]
\IfcRelNests.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement
Placement of the product in space, the placement can either be absolute (relative to the world coordinate system), relative (relative to the object placement of another product), or constraint (e.g. relative to grid axes). It is determined by the various subtypes of IfcObjectPlacement, which includes the axis placement information to determine the transformation for the object coordinate system.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Pset_ElementKinematics\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_EnvironmentalImpactIndicators\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_EnvironmentalImpactValues\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_ManufacturerOccurrence\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_ManufacturerTypeInformation\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_Warranty\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
1.1.2.5.2.1 IfcBuiltElement

IfcBuiltElement

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcBuiltElement
IfcBuiltElement
Body AdvancedSweptSolid Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body SurfaceModel Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body SweptSolid Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body SweptSolid PolyCurve Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body Tessellation Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Element Composition\IfcElement.Decomposes[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatingObject
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Body Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
FootPrint Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.RepresentationIdentifier
\IfcLabel
The optional identifier of the representation as used within a project.
Mapped Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Reference Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Reference SweptSolid Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Reference SweptSolid PolyCurve Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Reference Tessellation Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Property Sets with Override\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name

Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType

(Query)\IfcKerb
IfcKerb
Pset_KerbCommon\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_KerbStone\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_OnSiteCastKerb\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_PrecastKerbStone\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Pset_RadiiKerbStone\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
1.1.2.5.2.1.14 IfcMember

IfcMember

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcMember
IfcMember
Pset_MemberCommon\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Qto_MemberBaseQuantities\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Body SweptSolid PolyCurve Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Body Tessellation Geometry\IfcElement.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Element Composition\IfcElement.Decomposes[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatingObject
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Mapped Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Property Sets with Override\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Property Sets with Override\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

Element Composition\IfcElement.Decomposes[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatingObject
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure

Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.

\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

\IfcRelAggregates.RelatingObject
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Mapped Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.

\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >

Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Mapped Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Profile Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialProfileSet.MaterialProfiles[*]
\IfcMaterialProfile.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material profile is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.

\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.
1.1.2.5.2.3.1 IfcDistributionControlElement

IfcDistributionControlElement

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcDistributionControlElement
IfcDistributionControlElement
Component to Distribution System\IfcDistributionElement.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
\IfcDistributionSystem.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Port Nesting\IfcDistributionElement
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.

\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Body']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext

\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Element Composition\IfcElement.Decomposes[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatingObject
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Mapped Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Property Sets with Override\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.

Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Box Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations['Box']
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
CoG Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Name
The word or group of words by which the product representation is known.
Mapped Geometry\IfcProduct.Representation
\IfcProductDefinitionShape.Representations[*]
\IfcShapeRepresentation.ContextOfItems
\IfcGeometricRepresentationContext
Definition of the representation context for which the different subtypes of representation are valid.
Product Linear Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLinearPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2PlacementLinear
Product Local Placement\IfcProduct.ObjectPlacement
\IfcLocalPlacement.RelativePlacement
\IfcAxis2Placement3D
Geometric placement that defines the transformation from the related coordinate system into the relating. The placement can be either 2D or 3D, depending on the dimension count of the coordinate system.
Product Relative Positioning\IfcProduct.PositionedRelativeTo[*]
\IfcRelPositions.RelatingPositioningElement
\IfcPositioningElement
Positioning element defining the source of the relative position.
Assignment to Group\IfcObject.HasAssignments[*]
\IfcRelAssignsToGroup.RelatingGroup
Reference to group that contains all assigned group members.
Object Predefined Type\IfcObject.ObjectType
\IfcLabel
The type denotes a particular type that indicates the object further. The use has to be established at the level of instantiable subtypes. In particular it holds the user defined type, if the enumeration of the attribute _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED.
Object Typing\IfcObject.IsTypedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByType.RelatingType
\IfcTypeObject.Name
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Object User Identity\IfcObject.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Property Sets for Objects\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Property Sets with Override\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Quantity Sets\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Classification Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesClassification.RelatingClassification
\IfcClassificationReference.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.
1.1.2.5.2.3.1.5 IfcProtectiveDeviceTrippingUnit

IfcProtectiveDeviceTrippingUnit

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange

\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.

Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.

\IfcRelVoidsElement

\IfcIdentifier
The _Identification_ provides a unique identifier of the referenced item within the external source (classification, document or library). It may be provided as * a key, e.g. a classification notation, like NF2.3 * a handle * a uuid or guid It may be human readable (such as a key) or not (such as a handle or uuid) depending on the context of its usage (which has to be determined by local agreement). { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE Attribute renamed from _ItemReference_ for consistency. >
Document Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesDocument.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Library Association\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesLibrary.RelatingLibrary
\IfcLibraryReference.Location
\IfcURIReference
Location, where the external source (classification, document or library) can be accessed by electronic means. The electronic location is provided as an URI, and would normally be given as an URL location string. { .change-ifc2x4} > IFC4 CHANGE  The data type has been changed from _IfcLabel_ to _IfcURIReference_ > .
Material Constituent Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialConstituentSet.MaterialConstituents[*]
\IfcMaterialConstituent.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material constituent is known.
Material Profile Set\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterialProfileSet.MaterialProfiles[*]
\IfcMaterialProfile.Name
\IfcLabel
The name by which the material profile is known.
Material Single\IfcObjectDefinition.HasAssociations[*]
\IfcRelAssociatesMaterial.RelatingMaterial
\IfcMaterial
Material definition assigned to the elements or element types.
Revision Control\IfcRoot.OwnerHistory
\IfcOwnerHistory.OwningUser
\IfcPersonAndOrganization.ThePerson
\IfcPerson.Identification
\IfcIdentifier
Identification of the person.
Software Identity\IfcRoot.GlobalId
\IfcGloballyUniqueId
Assignment of a globally unique identifier within the entire software world.
1.1.2.5.2.3.2.2.1 IfcAirToAirHeatRecovery

IfcAirToAirHeatRecovery

FieldMappingDefinition AbRV-00 Minimum RequirementsAbRV-E1b-ARCT Alignment Reference Cant ExchangeAbRV-E2a-TRST Track Structures ExchangeAbRV-E5-SIGN Energy ExchangeAbRV-E6-ENGY Signalling ExchangeAbRV-E8-TECO Telecommunications Exchange
(Query)\IfcAirToAirHeatRecovery
IfcAirToAirHeatRecovery
Pset_AirToAirHeatRecoveryTypeCommon\IfcObject
The IFC class identifier indicating the subtype of object.
Qto_AirToAirHeatRecoveryBaseQuantities\IfcObject.IsDefinedBy[*]
\IfcRelDefinesByProperties.RelatingPropertyDefinition
\IfcElementQuantity.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.

Element Decomposition\IfcElement.IsDecomposedBy[*]
\IfcRelAggregates.RelatedObjects[*]
\IfcElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
Element Occurrence Attributes\IfcElement.Tag
\IfcIdentifier
The tag (or label) identifier at the particular instance of a product, e.g. the serial number, or the position number. It is the identifier at the occurrence level.
Element Voiding\IfcElement.HasOpenings[*]
\IfcRelVoidsElement
Reference to the _IfcRelVoidsElement_ relationship that creates an opening in an element. An element can incorporate zero-to-many openings. For each opening, that voids the element, a new relationship _IfcRelVoidsElement_ is generated.
Spatial Containment\IfcElement.ContainedInStructure[*]
\IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure.RelatingStructure
\IfcSpatialElement.Name
\IfcLabel
Optional name for use by the participating software systems or users. For some subtypes of IfcRoot the insertion of the Name attribute may be required. This would be enforced by a where rule.
